tags.name: slo
tags.description: SLO APIs enable you to define, manage and track service-level objectives

post.description: You must have `all` privileges for the **SLOs** feature in the **Observability** section of the Kibana feature privileges.

409.description: Conflict - The SLO id already exists

get.summary: Get a paginated list of SLOs
get.description: You must have the `read` privileges for the **SLOs** feature in the **Observability** section of the Kibana feature privileges.

parameters.name: kqlQuery
parameters.description: A valid kql query to filter the SLO with

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page to use for pagination, must be greater or equal than 1

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Number of SLOs returned by page

parameters.name: hideStale
parameters.description: Hide stale SLOs from the list as defined by stale SLO threshold in SLO settings

get.description: You must have the `read` privileges for the **SLOs** feature in the **Observability** section of the Kibana feature privileges.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: the specific instanceId used by the summary calculation

put.description: You must have the `write` privileges for the **SLOs** feature in the **Observability** section of the Kibana feature privileges.

delete.description: You must have the `write` privileges for the **SLOs** feature in the **Observability** section of the Kibana feature privileges.

post.description: You must have the `write` privileges for the **SLOs** feature in the **Observability** section of the Kibana feature privileges.
You must have the `write` privileges for the **SLOs** feature in the **Observability** section of the Kibana feature privileges.
You must have the `write` privileges for the **SLOs** feature in the **Observability** section of the Kibana feature privileges.

post.summary: Batch delete rollup and summary data
post.description: The deletion occurs for the specified list of `sloId` and `instanceId`. You must have `all` privileges for the **SLOs** feature in the **Observability** section of the Kibana feature privileges.

space_id.name: spaceId
space_id.description: An identifier for the space. If `/s/` and the identifier are omitted from the path, the default space is used.

indicator_properties_apm_availability.title: APM availability
indicator_properties_apm_availability.description: Defines properties for the APM availability indicator type

params.description: An object containing the indicator parameters.

filter.description: KQL query used for filtering the data

index.description: The index used by APM metrics

oneOf.description: the KQL query to filter the documents with.

kql_with_filters_good.title: KQL query for good events
kql_with_filters_good.description: The KQL query used to define the good events.

oneOf.description: the KQL query to filter the documents with.

kql_with_filters_total.title: KQL query for all events
kql_with_filters_total.description: The KQL query used to define all events.

oneOf.description: the KQL query to filter the documents with.

indicator_properties_custom_kql.title: Custom Query
indicator_properties_custom_kql.description: Defines properties for a custom query indicator type

params.description: An object containing the indicator parameters.

index.description: The index or index pattern to use

dataViewId.description: The kibana data view id to use, primarily used to include data view runtime mappings. Make sure to save SLO again if you add/update run time fields to the data view and if those fields are being used in slo queries.

timestampField.description: The timestamp field used in the source indice.

indicator_properties_apm_latency.title: APM latency
indicator_properties_apm_latency.description: Defines properties for the APM latency indicator type

params.description: An object containing the indicator parameters.

filter.description: KQL query used for filtering the data

index.description: The index used by APM metrics

indicator_properties_custom_metric.title: Custom metric
indicator_properties_custom_metric.description: Defines properties for a custom metric indicator type

params.description: An object containing the indicator parameters.

index.description: The index or index pattern to use

dataViewId.description: The kibana data view id to use, primarily used to include data view runtime mappings. Make sure to save SLO again if you add/update run time fields to the data view and if those fields are being used in slo queries.

filter.description: the KQL query to filter the documents with.

timestampField.description: The timestamp field used in the source indice.

good.description: An object defining the "good" metrics and equation

metrics.description: List of metrics with their name, aggregation type, and field.

name.description: The name of the metric. Only valid options are A-Z

aggregation.description: The aggregation type of the metric. Only valid option is "sum"

filter.description: The filter to apply to the metric.

equation.description: The equation to calculate the "good" metric.

total.description: An object defining the "total" metrics and equation

metrics.description: List of metrics with their name, aggregation type, and field.

name.description: The name of the metric. Only valid options are A-Z

aggregation.description: The aggregation type of the metric. Only valid option is "sum"

filter.description: The filter to apply to the metric.

equation.description: The equation to calculate the "total" metric.

indicator_properties_histogram.title: Histogram indicator
indicator_properties_histogram.description: Defines properties for a histogram indicator type

params.description: An object containing the indicator parameters.

index.description: The index or index pattern to use

dataViewId.description: The kibana data view id to use, primarily used to include data view runtime mappings. Make sure to save SLO again if you add/update run time fields to the data view and if those fields are being used in slo queries.

filter.description: the KQL query to filter the documents with.

timestampField.description: The timestamp field used in the source indice.

field.description: The field use to aggregate the good events.

aggregation.description: The type of aggregation to use.

from.description: The starting value of the range. Only required for "range" aggregations.

to.description: The ending value of the range. Only required for "range" aggregations.

field.description: The field use to aggregate the good events.

aggregation.description: The type of aggregation to use.

from.description: The starting value of the range. Only required for "range" aggregations.

to.description: The ending value of the range. Only required for "range" aggregations.

timeslice_metric_basic_metric_with_field.title: Timeslice Metric Basic Metric with Field

name.description: The name of the metric. Only valid options are A-Z

aggregation.description: The aggregation type of the metric.

filter.description: The filter to apply to the metric.

name.description: The name of the metric. Only valid options are A-Z

aggregation.description: The aggregation type of the metric. Only valid option is "percentile"

filter.description: The filter to apply to the metric.

name.description: The name of the metric. Only valid options are A-Z

aggregation.description: The aggregation type of the metric. Only valid option is "doc_count"

filter.description: The filter to apply to the metric.

indicator_properties_timeslice_metric.title: Timeslice metric
indicator_properties_timeslice_metric.description: Defines properties for a timeslice metric indicator type

params.description: An object containing the indicator parameters.

index.description: The index or index pattern to use

dataViewId.description: The kibana data view id to use, primarily used to include data view runtime mappings. Make sure to save SLO again if you add/update run time fields to the data view and if those fields are being used in slo queries.

filter.description: the KQL query to filter the documents with.

timestampField.description: The timestamp field used in the source indice.

metric.description: An object defining the metrics, equation, and threshold to determine if it's a good slice or not

metrics.description: List of metrics with their name, aggregation type, and field.

equation.description: The equation to calculate the metric.

comparator.description: The comparator to use to compare the equation to the threshold.

threshold.description: The threshold used to determine if the metric is a good slice or not.

time_window.title: Time window
time_window.description: Defines properties for the SLO time window

duration.description: the duration formatted as {duration}{unit}. Accepted values for rolling: 7d, 30d, 90d. Accepted values for calendar aligned: 1w (weekly) or 1M (monthly)

type.description: Indicates weither the time window is a rolling or a calendar aligned time window.

budgeting_method.title: Budgeting method
budgeting_method.description: The budgeting method to use when computing the rollup data.

objective.title: Objective
objective.description: Defines properties for the SLO objective

target.description: the target objective between 0 and 1 excluded

timesliceTarget.description: the target objective for each slice when using a timeslices budgeting method

timesliceWindow.description: the duration of each slice when using a timeslices budgeting method, as {duraton}{unit}

syncDelay.description: The synch delay to apply to the transform. Default 1m

frequency.description: Configure how often the transform runs, default 1m

preventInitialBackfill.description: Prevents the transform from backfilling data when it starts.

initial.description: The initial error budget, as 1 - objective

consumed.description: The error budget consummed, as a percentage of the initial value.

remaining.description: The error budget remaining, as a percentage of the initial value.

isEstimated.description: Only for SLO defined with occurrences budgeting method and calendar aligned time window.

group_by.title: Group by
group_by.description: optional group by field or fields to use to generate an SLO per distinct value

enabled.description: Indicate if the SLO is enabled

instanceId.description: the value derived from the groupBy field, if present, otherwise '*'

find_slo_response.title: Find SLO response
find_slo_response.description: A paginated response of SLOs matching the query.

message.example:
[security_exception
	Root causes:
		security_exception: unable to authenticate user [elastics] for REST request [/_security/_authenticate]]: unable to authenticate user [elastics] for REST request [/_security/_authenticate]

	Root causes:

create_slo_request.title: Create SLO request
create_slo_request.description: The create SLO API request body varies depending on the type of indicator, time window and budgeting method.

id.description: A optional and unique identifier for the SLO. Must be between 8 and 36 chars

update_slo_request.title: Update SLO request
update_slo_request.description: The update SLO API request body varies depending on the type of indicator, time window and budgeting method. Partial update is handled.

enabled.description: Indicate if the SLO is enabled

delete_slo_instances_request.title: Delete SLO instances request
delete_slo_instances_request.description: The delete SLO instances request takes a list of SLO id and instance id, then delete the rollup and summary data. This API can be used to remove the staled data of an instance SLO that no longer get updated.

list.description: An array of slo id and instance id
